SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.xith3d.loaders.texture
Class TextureLoader

java.lang.Object
  com.xith3d.loaders.texture.TextureLoader
public class TextureLoader
extends Object

This object manages all the textures needed by the program. Textures can be retrieved by name. Multiple paths for actual image files can be registered with the factory. There are plans to allow the texture factory to be streamed to disk for faster re-loading.

Author:
David Yazel

tf

public static TextureLoader tf

XITH3D_USERDATAKEY_ICFILENAME

public static final Object XITH3D_USERDATAKEY_ICFILENAME
The user data key object for the file name meta data of the ImageComponent objects in a Texture object. Note that Object-type key is used to guarantee that conventional (old) user data namespace will never intersect with other user-defined namespaces.

Constructor Detail

TextureLoader

public TextureLoader()
This constructor takes a AWT component because the TextureLoader requires one.

Method Detail

getInstance

public static TextureLoader getInstance()

setCachePath

public void setCachePath(String path)
if a cache path is set then the first time you load a texture it will be saved off into a big file which can be memory mapped for super fast loading speed the second time around.

Parameters:
path -

registerPath

public void registerPath(String name)
This will register a path for the texture loader to search when attemping to locate textures. Each path should end with a /

registerJarPath

public void registerJarPath(String jarName)
This will register a URL path for the texture loader to search when attemping to locate textures.

setICFileNameMetaData

public void setICFileNameMetaData(Texture tex,
                                  String fileName)
A helper method that sets the file name meta data for the ImageComponent objects of a Texture.

Parameters:
tex - The Texture object that needs the meta data set.
fileName - The String file name of the image that was used to create the texture.

loadImageFast

public BufferedImage loadImageFast(String name,
                                   boolean expectAlpha)
Loads the image as fast as it can. If it cannot load the image then it returns null.

Loads the texture into the specified format. IF it is in the cache then it will return the cached item

getTexture

public Texture getTexture(String name)
Checks the local cache for the same texture. If it exists then it returns a reference to it, else it attempts to load it by searching through the path. If it loads it then a reference will be placed in the cache.
